result.execSummary:
The defendant Stephon D Davis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Stephon D Davis is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Stephon D Davis was found guilty of Attempt Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm [Modifiers: Use Dangerous Weapon (Misdemeanor)], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: ++ The Court also advised that the Court will consider expunction if there are no violations of his probation, no violations inside the years conditional time, that he doesn't come back dirty on some occasion or late or absconds or anything else from his sentence. As long as he complies the Court will expunge the record.hb

miscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.   Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.
**  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  Submit a DNA sample (unless previously provided).
** Pay DNA surcharges.
** Pay restitution plus surcharges.   May Not have contact with Tiana R, felons, drug users or dealers unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

timeConds.notes: Huber allowed.  Credit for 5 days.  Unless work crew is expressly prohibited by the Court, an inmate serving time as a condition of probation is eligible for work crew and may receive a credit of one day for every 3 days of work performed.

Attorney Michael Graveley appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney D. Hertz-Mcgrath.  Clerk/S. Garcia. Court withholds sentence and places deft on probation for 3 years w/ conditions concurrent to 16CF1.  1 year conditional jail w/ Huber privileges; credit for 5 days served; deft to report to jail on 7/2/16 @ 6:00 p.m.  Deft to submit DNA sample and pay $250.00 DNA surcharge; restitution ordered in the amount of $2,363.00 (by stipulation of deft).  Bond applied; bond also applied to costs in file 16CF1; any remainder to be returned to poster.  No contact with Tiana R., felons, or drug users or dealers.  7/7/16 NOTE:  The Court also advised that the Court will consider expunction if there are no violations of his probation, no violations inside the years conditional time, that he doesn't come back dirty on some occasion or late or absconds or anything else from his sentence. As long as he complies the Court will expunge the record.hb
